intro: Vouacapoua inermis, commonly known as the Amazonian white angel's trumpet, is a climbing plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, glabrous stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
